techmeme.title: In its current form, OpenAI's Operator is more of an intriguing demo than a product useful for most people, but it points to a future of powerful AI agents (Kevin Roose/New York Times)
Donald Trump's EO imposing levies on China says the "de minimis" exemption for items under $800 no longer applies, which could affect Alibaba, Shein, and others (Bloomberg)
The UK announces four new laws that make it illegal to possess, create, or distribute AI tools designed to produce CSAM, becoming the first country to do so (Sima Kotecha/BBC)
How Israeli startups like Xtend are helping the country's war effort, with ~50% of anti-drone tech used since the October 7 attacks coming from startups (Emily Rose/Reuters)
Hugging Face's Thomas Wolf and other experts say startups like DeepSeek and the rise of AI agents may erode the value of LLMs from OpenAI and Big Tech companies (Ryan Browne/CNBC)
